questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages and web applications.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used for the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag is used for the largest and most important heading. HTML has six heading levels from <h1> (largest) to <h6> (smallest).

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. It is used to style and layout web pages, controlling colors, fonts, spacing, and positioning.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks. The href attribute specifies the URL destination: Link text.

questions.question: How do you insert a comment in CSS?
questions.explanation: CSS comments use /* comment */. HTML comments use <!-- comment -->, and JavaScript uses // or /* */.

questions.question: Which property is used to change the text color in CSS?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to change the text color. For example: color: red; or color: #FF0000;

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a checkbox?
questions.explanation: The correct syntax is <input type='checkbox'>. The type attribute determines what kind of input element to display.

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the text size?
questions.explanation: The 'font-size' property controls text size. Values can be in pixels (px), ems (em), rems (rem), or percentages (%).

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for inserting an image?
questions.explanation: The tag with src (source) attribute displays images. The alt attribute provides alternative text for accessibility and when images fail to load.

questions.question: Which HTML tag defines an unordered list?
questions.explanation: The <ul> tag creates an unordered (bulleted) list. <ol> creates ordered (numbered) lists. <li> defines individual list items.

questions.question: How do you make text bold in HTML?
questions.explanation: <strong> (semantic importance) and <b> (visual styling) both make text bold. <strong> is preferred for accessibility.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the background color?
questions.explanation: The 'background-color' property sets the background color. The shorthand 'background' property can also include images and other properties.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?
questions.explanation: <input type='text'> creates a single-line text input field. Other types include 'email', 'password', 'number', etc.

questions.question: Which property is used to add space between the border and content?
questions.explanation: Padding adds space inside the element between the border and content. Margin adds space outside the element's border.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <div> tag?
options: To group and style block-level content
questions.explanation: The <div> tag is a container for grouping and styling block-level content. It's commonly used with CSS classes and IDs.

questions.question: Which CSS selector targets elements by their ID?
questions.explanation: The # symbol selects elements by ID: #myId. The . symbol selects by class: .myClass. Element names are used directly: div.

questions.question: What does the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration do?
options: Tells the browser this is an HTML5 document
questions.explanation: <!DOCTYPE html> tells the browser to render the page in HTML5 mode. It should be the first line in an HTML document.

questions.question: Which HTML attribute specifies an alternate text for an image?
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for images, important for accessibility and displayed when images fail to load.

questions.question: How do you select elements with class 'menu' in CSS?
questions.explanation: Class selectors use a period (.): .menu selects all elements with class='menu'. The # symbol is for IDs.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to make text italic?
questions.explanation: The 'font-style' property with value 'italic' makes text italic. The <em> or <i> HTML tags can also create italic text.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a dropdown list?
questions.explanation: The <select> tag creates a dropdown list. Individual options are defined with <option> tags inside the <select> element.

questions.question: Which property controls the space between elements?
questions.explanation: Margin controls space outside an element's border, between elements. Padding controls space inside the element, between border and content.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <span> tag?
options: To group and style inline content
questions.explanation: The <span> tag is an inline container for styling text and content without breaking the flow. <div> is the block-level equivalent.

questions.question: Which CSS property makes elements display side by side?
questions.explanation: Elements can be displayed side by side using 'display: inline' or 'inline-block', 'float: left/right', or modern methods like flexbox and grid.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a table?
questions.explanation: The <table> tag creates a table. Use <tr> for rows, <th> for header cells, and <td> for data cells.

questions.question: Which property changes the font type in CSS?
questions.explanation: The 'font-family' property specifies the font. Multiple fonts can be listed as fallbacks: font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

questions.question: What does the z-index property control?
options: The stacking order of positioned elements
questions.explanation: z-index controls the stacking order of positioned elements (position: absolute, relative, or fixed). Higher values appear on top.

questions.question: Which HTML tag defines a paragraph?
questions.explanation:
The

tag defines a paragraph. Browsers automatically add space before and after paragraphs.

questions.question: How do you center an element horizontally in CSS?
questions.explanation: For block elements with a defined width, 'margin: 0 auto;' centers horizontally. For text, use 'text-align: center;'.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag?
options: To provide metadata about the HTML document
questions.explanation: The <meta> tag provides metadata like character encoding, viewport settings, descriptions, and keywords. It's placed in the <head> section.
